messages.content: As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name:  I will derive this data from the following paragraph: On September 21, DET. O. P. Richards was called to Oakridge High School after reports of vandalism in the science labs. Principal informants were Dr. Evans, the science department head, and Ms. Grant, a janitor. FORWARD COPY TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION. INFORMANT DOCS. Lt. Q. R. Stevens - OPERATIONS Det. Richards, Jr. .. INVESTIGATIONS. Detective S. T. Jenkins and Detective U. V. Lopez were assigned to gather evidence. BLAKE 11:55 Vandalism Dr. Evans reported broken equipment, while Ms. Grant noticed graffiti on the walls. Print. Technician Ron collected fingerprints. CONTINUED FORWARD TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION 3- STATUS [CHECK ONE] Det. Richards Jr, Det. Jenkins, Det. Lopez OPERATIONS Lt. Stevens INFORMANT Grant, Beatrice 44 Pine Drive, Oakridge, Colorado 183-760. 93795. BLAKE 11:55 Vandalism By 1:40 PM, Detectives Richards, Jenkins, and Lopez, under Lieutenant Stevens' supervision, identified several student suspects from the prints. Captain W. X. Yates requested student records. Sergeant Y. Z. Parker and Sergeant A. B. Reid held interviews with potential witnesses. By 3:15 PM, a group of students admitted to the prank. FORWARD TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION 3- STATUS [CHECK ONE] Det. Richards Jr, Det. Jenkins, Det. Lopez OPERATIONS Lt. Stevens AFFIDAVIT - Vandalism Report 1) Lab Inventory 2) Witness Statements 3) F.I.R. 4) Photographs of Damage 5) School CCTV (6) Other Details LINE UP INFO ASSISTANT CHIEF DEPUTY IN CHARGE D. Smith O.H.S.P.D. 26.100 P62 2875 Evans, MARTIN NAME: ADDRESS: TELEPHONE: 160-3175 DETECTIVE: O. RICHARDS ITEM: 62-5250- 103 CRIME: 11:55 IDENTIFICATION NUMBER 83590 - CONFIRMED John Doe DATE 3/05/24 FORWARD TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION CONTINUED.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: DET. O. P. Richards  Officer Context: On September 21, DET. O. P. Richards was called to Oakridge High School after reports of vandalism in the science labs. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Lt. Q. R. Stevens  Officer Context: Lt. Q. R. Stevens - OPERATIONS Officer Role: Lieutenant Officer Name: Detective S. T. Jenkins  Officer Context: Detective S. T. Jenkins and Detective U. V. Lopez were assigned to gather evidence. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Detective U. V. Lopez  Officer Context: Detective S. T. Jenkins and Detective U. V. Lopez were assigned to gather evidence. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Technician Ron  Officer Context: Print. Technician Ron collected fingerprints. Officer Role: Technician (from the Crime Lab) Officer Name: Detective Richards  Officer Context: By 1:40 PM, Detectives Richards, Jenkins, and Lopez, under Lieutenant Stevens' supervision, identified several student suspects from the prints. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Detective Jenkins  Officer Context: By 1:40 PM, Detectives Richards, Jenkins, and Lopez, under Lieutenant Stevens' supervision, identified several student suspects from the prints. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Detective Lopez  Officer Context: By 1:40 PM, Detectives Richards, Jenkins, and Lopez, under Lieutenant Stevens' supervision, identified several student suspects from the prints. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Captain W. X. Yates  Officer Context: Captain W. X. Yates requested student records. Officer Role: Captain Officer Name: Sergeant Y. Z. Parker  Officer Context: Sergeant Y. Z. Parker and Sergeant A. B. Reid held interviews with potential witnesses. Officer Role: Sergeant Officer Name: Sergeant A. B. Reid Officer Context: Sergeant Y. Z. Parker and Sergeant A. B. Reid held interviews with potential witnesses. Officer Role: Sergeant
